July 31, 1957
Dr. Burton Paulu
K U 0 M, One Eddy Hall
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
It may not be early convenience, but it is convenient.
Yes, I think It is well to have a Constitution Com¬
mittee. However, I point out that that is not unrelated
to picture that Bronson always pushes. Professional
Advancement Committee gave some consideration to this,
but actual proposal was left to a Sub-Committee, and that
Sub-Committee hasn’t met, I believe, because of funds.
Another thing, these changes can’t be made in a hurry,
even in the first draft, and the assembly is entitled to
a 30-day notice before Convention time. Maybe one approach
would be to use the convention as a site for proposed
needed changes, and leave actual changes to the following
year.
Sincerely,
Frank E. Schooley
